acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour EC50=0.00051mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 1997).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 5 based on rat (female) LD50 value: 2100mg/kg (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Rat LC50 (4 hours) value is >1.1333mg/L (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts),  the category could not be specified only by this data. Therefore, it cannot be classified since data is insufficient.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat (female)
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 813 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: Agricultural Chemicals abstracts

carcinogenicity.rationale: Any organization had classified for carcinogenicity. But generating of tumors relevant to administration was not observed in the chronicity and the carcinogenicity test using rats and mice (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts). So it was set as the outside of Category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), though less bioaccumulative (BCF=46 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Liquid at a test temperature, 55degC. Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The substance cannot be classified because there are only negative data from in vitro tests (three kinds of tests) (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: There were no obvious reproductive toxicity in the dose causing general toxicity to parent animals in the peroral administration breeding toxicity test using rat, and in the teratogenicity test using rat and rabbit (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts). So it was considered as on the outside of Categry.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid or solid substances at 140degC are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since eye irritation was not admitted in the eye irritation test using a rabbit (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts), it was set as the outside of Category.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since erythema and edema were not observed in the skin irritation test on rabbits with 40% emulsion (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts), it was classified as out of Category.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Classified as out of category because the topical allergy tests using guinea pigs resulted negative (agrochemical abstract).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In the 13-week feeding oral administration tests using rat, since decrease in brains cholinesterase activities was observed with the given dose of the guidance value range of Category 1 (Agricultural Chemicals abstracts), it was classified into Category 1 (nervous systems).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (nervous system)
May cause damage to organs (gastrointestinal tract, eye)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Due to the descriptions that neurological symptoms, eye nebula and gastrointestinal ulcers were observed in the dosage range of the guidance value of Category 2 in the oral study using rat (Agricultural-Chemical abstracts), and that the effects on the nervous system was observed in the dosage range of the guidance value of Category 1in the inhalation exposure test using rat. So they were classified into Category 1 (nervous system) and 2 (eyes, digestive tracts).
